name: sawing, softwood | sawnwood, softwood, raw | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13677/documentation

This dataset represents the service of sawing one m3 softwood at a sawmill.;The process chain in a sawmill is a net of interlinked processes; the process structure depends on the individual design and technologies in place for each sawmill. The structuring of the sawmilling processes is based on the identification of the core processes in a sawmill that are attributable to several co-products (such as upstream processes like forestry and transport of logs to the sawmill) sorting, storing and the sawing of the (debarked) log. Other processes are attributable directly to one of the co-products such as the chipping of residual wood (either after sawing or as part of the profile chipping), the chipping of the bark (the "debarking") or the suction of saw dust as collection and internal transport.;The following figure illustrates the general structure of the sawmilling processes before eventual drying and planing:;For the sawing, no distinction is made regarding different types of sawn wood products such as beams, boards and laths as sawing pattern largely depend on the diameter of the log and usually different types and sizes of sawn timber products are produced in the same cut. ;The Quebec inventory data contains a small amount of wood waste sent to landfill (0.6% of wood input). However, it was not included in the dataset.

The sawing process starts with the sorting of the log at the sawmill.

This activity ends with sawn softwood, at sawmill; the processing of all co-products form the sawing process are covered in separate datasets. The dataset includes dust emission.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Average data from 6 sawmills located in the province of Quebec, Canada.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Dimension sawmills, stud sawmills and both.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Mostly primary data from 6 sawmills located in the province of Quebec (Canada).
